items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.60 mAOD at 17:30 on 23/09/21 and 4.80 mAOD at 05:15 on 24/09/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 15 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 09:00 on 24/09/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message:
The flood alert for the Humber Estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall remains in place for this evenings tide (Thursday 23/09/21).  The particular area of concern is Kilnsea Village. Some overtopping and spray is expected in the Kilnsea village area as a result of a tidal surge between 7:30pm and 9:30pm on Thursday 23rd September. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads around  Kilnsea Village. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast.  

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as overtopping waves could be dangerous.  

This message will be updated in 8 hours, or as the situation changes.
